definition: an excerpt/a digest
to choose/to pick/to select/to elect
diary/record/to hit/to copy
surname Lu

sentences.english: Visit a local music store and sample each other's favorite artists.
sentences.chinese: 參觀當地的音像店，選錄對方喜歡的歌手音樂。

sentences.english: He extracted several paragraphs from the newspaper article to read at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他選錄了報上文章中幾段，在會議上念。

sentences.english: Typical Use:He extracted several paragraphs from the newspaper article to read at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他選錄了報上文章中的幾段，在會議中念。

sentences.english: The document he chose and compiled is very valuable. It should be recommended to everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他選錄的文件很有價值，應該推薦給大家看看。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming is the poet whose poems are selected most by Gushigui and valuated very highly.
sentences.chinese: 《古詩歸》選錄陶淵明詩作數量最多，且評價極高。

sentences.english: The record company selects and records some of his songs from different periods.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司選錄了他不同時期的歌曲。

definition: a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
Ma Zhiyuan (c. 1250-1321), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧[za2 ju4] tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan Dramatists 元曲四大家[Yuan2 qu3 Si4 Da4 jia1]
a Yuan dynasty form of musical comedy
to select and edit/to compile
poetic form or genre
add and delete
poetry in the old style
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to check and correct
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to comment/a point by point commentary
